protocol_name: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii nuclear transformation by electroporation.
protocol_name_html: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii nuclear transformation by electroporation.
description: This protocols describe the steps required for nuclear transformation of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii by electroporation.
before_start:
• Separate cuvettes
  • Prepare a ice bath
  • Allow linearized vectors to melt
warning: • High voltage is used in the electroporation, use EPIs and avoid contact with electrodes on the electroporator.
protocol_affiliation: University of São Paulo,University of California, San Diego
manuscript_citation: Molino JVD, Carvalho JCMd, Mayfield SP (2018) Comparison of secretory signal peptides for heterologous protein expression in microalgae: Expanding the secretion portfolio for Chlamydomonas reinhardtii. PLoS ONE 13(2): e0192433. doi: 10.1371/journal.pone.0192433
guidelines: Cell density for harvesting is important to overall transformant yields. It should be aimed to mid-log phase cells.

components.data:
1. Digest 3-5 µg of DNA with appropriate enzymes, for 3-5h at 37ºC.
  2. Column purify digestion (Avoid gel purify, since vector backbone helps to prevent intracelular DNAses action)
  3. Quantitate by absorbance measuring (Nanodrop)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Digest 3-5 µg of DNA with appropriate enzymes, for 3-5h at 37ºC.
  2. Column purify digestion (Avoid gel purify, since vector backbone helps to prevent intracelular DNAses action)
  3. Quantitate by absorbance measuring (Nanodrop)

components.data:
1. Aseptically inoculate 250 mL of TAP media with wild type cells. Either by scrappeing cells of a plate with a inocculating loop or from a previous cultured cells.
  2. Incubate at 25ºC, under constant shaking (~150-180 RPM) and light (60 µmols de photons/m2s) until a cell density of 3-6 x 106 cells/mL is reached
  3. Pellet cells in centrifuge tubes. Separate culture in sufficient amount of 50mL tubes (Falcons), and centrifuge for 10 min at 2000xg 
  4. Genttly ressupend cells at 3-6-108 cells/mL in TAP/40mM sucrose. (250 mL of culture usually yields 10 transformations)
components.name: Description

source_data.description:
1. Aseptically inoculate 250 mL of TAP media with wild type cells. Either by scrappeing cells of a plate with a inocculating loop or from a previous cultured cells.
  2. Incubate at 25ºC, under constant shaking (~150-180 RPM) and light (60 µmols de photons/m2s) until a cell density of 3-6 x 106 cells/mL is reached
  3. Pellet cells in centrifuge tubes. Separate culture in sufficient amount of 50mL tubes (Falcons), and centrifuge for 10 min at 2000xg 
  4. Genttly ressupend cells at 3-6-108 cells/mL in TAP/40mM sucrose. (250 mL of culture usually yields 10 transformations)

source_data.thread_title: Annotation on step 2 of Chlamydomonas reinhardtii nuclear transformation by electroporation.
source_data.protocol_name: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii nuclear transformation by electroporation.
source_data.protocol_name_html: Chlamydomonas reinhardtii nuclear transformation by electroporation.
source_data.annotation: Usually cells will reach desired concentration in 3 days, depending on the amount of inocculum
source_data.thread_text: Usually cells will reach desired concentration in 3 days, depending on the amount of inocculum
source_data.body: Usually cells will reach desired concentration in 3 days, depending on the amount of inocculum

components.data:
1. Add 250 µL of ressuspended cells (at 3-6-108 cells/mL) to each cuvette. Pippet up and down on DNA sample. Flick cuvette to mix DNA and cells. Shake cells to the bottom of the cuvette. Also add no DNA control.
    2. Incubate cells with DNA ON ICE for 5-10 min
    3. Wipe cuvette (to remove condensated water) and electroporate.
      • Voltage = 800 V
      • Capacitance = 25 µF
      • Resistance = infinity (∞) 
      • Gap = 4 mm
    5. Let recover for 5-10 min on cuvette
    6. Add 10 mL of Tap/40mM sucrose into one clean 50mL falcon tube per electroporation
    7. Gently transfer cells from cuvette to TAP/40 mM sucrose. Rinse cubette with TAP/40 mM sucrose and transfer remaining cells to Falcon tuve
    8. Incubate at room temperature on rocker overnight
    9. Pellet cells by centrifuging for 10 min at 2000xg
    10. Aseptically poor off supernatant. Add 600 µL of TAP/40 mM sucrose to pellet. Gently re-suspend cells and pipette onto 2 plates with appropriate antibiotics. ie. 400 µL of cells per plate, and let it dry aseptically without plate cover.
    11. Parafilm and place plates under constant light (60 µmols de photons/m2s), 25 ºC. Colonies should be visible in 5-7 days.

1. Add 250 µL of ressuspended cells (at 3-6-108 cells/mL) to each cuvette. Pippet up and down on DNA sample. Flick cuvette to mix DNA and cells. Shake cells to the bottom of the cuvette. Also add no DNA control.
    2. Incubate cells with DNA ON ICE for 5-10 min
    3. Wipe cuvette (to remove condensated water) and electroporate.
      • Voltage = 800 V
      • Capacitance = 25 µF
      • Resistance = infinity (∞) 
      • Gap = 4 mm
    5. Let recover for 5-10 min on cuvette
    6. Add 10 mL of Tap/40mM sucrose into one clean 50mL falcon tube per electroporation
    7. Gently transfer cells from cuvette to TAP/40 mM sucrose. Rinse cubette with TAP/40 mM sucrose and transfer remaining cells to Falcon tuve
    8. Incubate at room temperature on rocker overnight
    9. Pellet cells by centrifuging for 10 min at 2000xg
    10. Aseptically poor off supernatant. Add 600 µL of TAP/40 mM sucrose to pellet. Gently re-suspend cells and pipette onto 2 plates with appropriate antibiotics. ie. 400 µL of cells per plate, and let it dry aseptically without plate cover.
    11. Parafilm and place plates under constant light (60 µmols de photons/m2s), 25 ºC. Colonies should be visible in 5-7 days.

source_data.title: Incubate on liquid media for cell recovering
TAP 40 mM sucrose to re-suspend cells
